body_html:
I ended up using ubuntu 16.04 with PyTorch 3.0 (cuda 9.0), crashing due to memory issue has stopped. But still I get "cuda run time error: out of memory issue" . I noticed, that the error happens only when my GPU has less than 1GB of free space(GPU: 2GB Nvidia GT 750M).

So using this torch.cuda.empty_cache() frees up few memory from GPU but not much. I had to restart my jupyter kernel(which is frustrating) to get more free memory. Is there any other way to accomplish it?

So using this torch.cuda.empty_cache()  frees up few memory from GPU but not much. I had to restart my jupyter kernel(which is frustrating) to get more free memory. Is there any other way to accomplish it?
body:
I ended up using ubuntu 16.04 with PyTorch 3.0 (cuda 9.0), crashing due to memory issue has stopped. But still I get "cuda run time error: out of memory issue" . I noticed, that the error happens only when my GPU has less than 1GB of free space(GPU: 2GB Nvidia GT 750M). 

So using this torch.cuda.empty_cache()  frees up few memory from GPU but not much. I had to restart my jupyter kernel(which is frustrating) to get more free memory. Is there any other way to accomplish it?
